page_analysis.text_content:
Allowable extensions to existing encroachments

Fig 19 Allowable extensions of existing walls that encroach into required yards (on ground floor only)

A Extension of existing side yard encroachment
An existing wall that encroaches into the required interior side yard setback but is at least 5'-0" from the property line, may be extended at the same setback, in one direction only, at the ground floor only, for a distance equal to the length of the existing wall or 20' whichever is less.
Note: In the example below, two existing walls are encroaching--only one of them may be extended.

B Extension of existing front yard encroachment
An existing wall that encroaches into the required front yard setback but is at least 14'-0" from the property line, may be extended at the same setback, in one direction only, at the ground floor only, with both of the following provisions:
1) the length of the extension is no greater than that of the existing encroaching wall,
2) the combined length is no greater than one-half the maximum width of the house.

C Extension of existing street-side yard encroachment
An existing wall that encroaches into the required street side yard setback but is at least 10'-0" from the property line, may be extended at the same setback, in one direction only, at the ground floor only, for a distance equal to the length of the existing wall or 20' whichever is less.

Note:
• Encroaching walls that don't meet the minimum setback given for each case i.e., 5', 14', and 10', may not be extended nor may they may not be stepped back and then extended.
• Multiple protrusions are not permitted; addition must be contiguous with existing protrusion.
• Only for structures that were legally constructed, without a variance or an home-improvement exception (HIE).
• Only once in the life of the structure.
• Requires retention of the non-complying wall.
• Exceptions apply to special setbacks as well.

Key
- Lot line
- - - Required setback
- - - - Buildable area
- - - - - Sidewalk

Existing house
Addition

visual_elements.description: Three side-by-side schematic site plans illustrating allowable extensions of existing walls encroaching into required yards. Each plan shows a lot with labeled 'Rear yard', 'Front yard', and 'Interior side yard' or 'Street side yard'. The diagrams depict existing houses (shaded gray) and additions (shaded black) extending from existing walls. Dimensions and setback lines are marked, including '5' min.' for side yard, '14' min.' for front yard, and '10' min.' for street-side yard. Arrows and labels indicate 'Length of existing encroaching wall max.' and 'Half the width of the building max.'. A dashed line represents the buildable area, solid lines indicate lot lines, and a hatched area shows the sidewalk. A note below the left diagram states 'Only one of the two encroaching walls may be extended'.

Maximum combined length of front yard encroachment
technical_specifications.value: No greater than one-half the maximum width of the house

Maximum extension distance for street-side yard encroachment

subheadings: A Extension of existing side yard encroachment
B Extension of existing front yard encroachment
C Extension of existing street-side yard encroachment

additional_notes: Page number 25 at bottom right corner.
No handwritten annotations or stamps detected.
Text and diagrams are clear and legible.

qualifiers.text: An existing wall that encroaches into the required interior side yard setback but is at least 5'-0" from the property line
An existing wall that encroaches into the required front yard setback but is at least 14'-0" from the property line
An existing wall that encroaches into the required street side yard setback but is at least 10'-0" from the property line

conditions.text: Extension of existing side yard encroachment may be extended at the same setback, in one direction only, at the ground floor only, for a distance equal to the length of the existing wall or 20' whichever is less
The length of the extension is no greater than that of the existing encroaching wall
The combined length is no greater than one-half the maximum width of the house
Extension of existing front yard encroachment may be extended at the same setback, in one direction only, at the ground floor only

Extension of existing street-side yard encroachment may be extended at the same setback, in one direction only, at the ground floor only, for a distance equal to the length of the existing wall or 20' whichever is less

logical_relationships.expression: Extension of existing front yard encroachment allowed only if 1) the length of the extension is no greater than that of the existing encroaching wall, 2) the combined length is no greater than one-half the maximum width of the house, and 3) extension is at the same setback, in one direction only, at the ground floor only

execution_sequence.action: Verify existing wall meets minimum setback requirement
Check extension length and direction conditions
